newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: South American port conditions - Lloyds.
newsitem.headline: South American port conditions - Lloyds.

text.p: Port conditions from Lloyds Shipping Intelligence Service --

ARGENTINA, May 13 - Santa Fe - No vessels berthed, none in roads, none due. Max. recommended draft 21 ft. 7 ins. at access channel. Diamante - No vessels berthed, none in roads, 3 due. Max. recommended draft 21 ft. 7 ins. at passage KM 520. San Lorenzo - Six vessels berthed, all loading, of which 1 sbm, 1 soya, 1 sun oil, 3 maize. 6 Vessels in roads, 38 due at 6 terminals during this week and next. Forecast indicates that draft will fall approx. 0.15 metres during the next week. Pasa berth draft 18 ft. 8 ins. Fw.

Rosario - Four vessels berthed of which 3 loading (1 by-products, 1 fruit, 1 steel billets), 1 under repair. No vessels in roads, 14 due within this week and next. Forecast indicates that draft will fall appx. 0.20 metres during the next week. Villa Constitucion - No vessels berthed, none in roads, 3 due. Elevator berths - Max. draft 22 ft. 0 ins. Fw. San Nicolas - Three vessels berthed, all discharging, of which 2 steel products, 1 coal. 1 Vessel in road awaiting orders, 7 due within the next week. Forecast indicates that draft will fall approx. 0.15 metres during the next week.

San Pedro - No vessels berthed, none in roads, none due. Forecast indicates that draft will fall approx. 0.15 metres during the next week. San Lorenzo/Rosario/San Nicolas/San Pedro - Max. recommended draft 31 ft. 4 ins. Fw. (high tide). Buenos Aires - 17 Vessels in port, 20 due within the next week. Max. recommended draft 31 ft. 6 ins. Fw. high tide Naabsa (guided by entrance channel). Dock sud - Max. recommended draft 28/29 ft. Fw. high tide Naabsa (guided by entrance channel). Necochea - Five vessels berthed of which 1 discharging urea, 4 loading (1 wood-chips, 3 wheat). No vessels in roads, 10 due within the next week. Max. recommended draft at entrance channel 40 ft. 0 ins. Bw. Bahia Blanca - Three vessels berthed (all loading maize), none in roads, 10 due within the next week. Drafts vary for individual berths.

BRAZIL, May 13 - Vitoria - Four vessels berthed of which 2 bulk wheat dischargers, 1 cellulose loader, 1 fertiliser. Tubarao - 3 Iron ore loaders. Praia Mole - 2 Steel products loaders, 2 coal dischargers. Portocel - 1 Cellulose loader. Ubu - 1 Iron ore loader. 18 Vessels waiting in roads. Santos - 16 Vessels berthed of which 4 full containers, 1 bulk cement, 1 container loader, 2 wheat dischargers, 1 general cargo loader/discharger, 1 general cargo discharger, 1 bulk soya loader, 1 chemical products discharger, 1 salt discharger, 1 fertiliser discharger, 1 soda discharger, 1 pellets loader, 1 general cargo loader. 6 Vessels waiting in roads, 63 due over the next 7 days.

PRIVATE TERMINALS - Cosipa - 2 Steel products loaders. Ultrafertil - No vessels. Paranagua - 15 Vessels berthed of which 1 container discharger, 6 general cargo dischargers, 2 fertiliser dischargers, 2 pellets loaders, 1 sugar loader, 2 soya loaders, 1 general cargo. 22 Vessels waiting in roads of which for loading, 6 sugar, 9 pellets, 6 soya. For discharging, 1 container. 25 Vessels due over the next 7 days. Rio Grande - Five vessels berthed of which 2 full containers, 2 soya bean loaders, 1 soya loader. 1 Vessel waiting in roads, 13 due over the next 10 days.

Rio de Janeiro - 10 Vessels berthed of which 1 general cargo/container discharger, 2 wheat dischargers, 1 paper discharger, 1 general cargo discharger, 3 container dischargers, 1 general cargo loader, 1 steel products loader. Tecon - 3 Vessels, 29 due over the next 7 days. Sao Sebastiao - Tebar - 3 Vessels berthed. Commercial quay - No vessels, none in roads, 7 due over the next 7 days.

COLOMBIA, May 13 - Barranquilla - Two general cargo vessels berthed, none anchored, 14 due (3 bulkers, 4 containers, 7 general cargo), no delays. Cartagena - Four vessels berthed (2 containers, 2 general cargo), none anchored. 22 Vessels due (2 bulkers, 13 containers, 5 general cargo, 2 passenger vessels), no delays. Santa Marta - Six vessels berthed (1 bulker, 2 containers, 3 general cargo). 3 Anchored (1 bulker, 2 general cargo). 12 Vessels due (2 bulkers, 2 containers, 7 general cargo, 1 pcc), no delays. Buenaventura - Six vessels berthed (2 bulkers, 2 containers, 1 tanker, 1 general cargo), 1 tanker anchored. 29 Vessels due (6 bulkers, 15 containers, 6 general cargo, 2 pcc), with the following delays, bulkers 5 days, containers/general cargo 1 day.

PERU, May 12 - No strikes. Callao - Three vessels anchored, 5 general cargo/container berthed, no berthing delays. Paita - No vessels anchored, 1 general cargo berthed, no berthing delays. Bayovar, Pisco - No vessels, no delays. Talara - One vessel anchored, 1 oil tanker berthed, no berthing delays. Chimbote - Three vessels anchored, 4 fish meal vessels berthed, no berthing delays. Ilo - Two vessels anchored, no berthing delays.

VENEZUELA, May 12 - Puerto Cabello - Two vessels anchored. 11 Vessels berthed of which 6 grain cargo, 2 general cargo, 1 bulker, 2 containers. Piers 1 and 2 closed. Guanta - Four vessels anchored. 5 Vessels berthed of which 1 grain cargo, 2 general cargo, 1 bulk cargo, 1 containers. May 13 - All ports working normally. Orinoco river - Draft 13/5 to 34 ft. 6 ins. Puerto Ordaz - Two vessels operating of which 1 loading iron pellets, 1 loading/discharging general cargo. 8 Vessels due. Boca Grande - One vessel loading iron ore. Palua - Three vessels due. Mile 178 - Three vessels waiting at anchorage to load. Matanzas - Six vessels operating of which 5 loading steel products, 1 loading/discharging general cargo. San Felix - One vessel loading steel products. 1 Vessel due.

Alcasa - One vessel discharging coke. Punta Cuchillo - One vessel loading refined products, 1 vessel due. Interalumina - One vessel loading alumina. La Guaira - Two vessels loading/discharging general cargo, 1 passenger vessel. 3 Vessels under repair, 9 due. Puerto Cabello - 12 Vessels loading/discharging general cargo, 14 due. Guanta - Three vessels operating of which 2 loading/discharging general cargo, 1 discharging salt. Amuay - Five vessels loading refined products, 2 waiting anchorage to load. Cardon - Three vessels loading refined products, 2 waiting at anchorage to load. Guaranao - One vessel loading/discharging general cargo.
